member_organisations: Members of the association are all 311 municipalities in Finland. This list can be found on www.localfinland.fi -page
fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, Budget, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Culture, International co-operation and development, Customs, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Public Health, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Transport, Climate Action, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives:
-MFF 
-Future of regional policy after 2020 
-Integrated EU policy for the Arctic 
-EMU 
-The European Pillar of Social Rights 
-Youth initiative 
-Implementation of the Circular Economy Action Plan 
-Implementation of the Energy Union Strategy 
-Urban Agenda
organisation_name: Association of Finnish Local and Regional Authorities (AFLRA)
section: VI - Organisations representing local, regional and municipal authorities, other public or mixed entities, etc.
membership: All details can be found from www.localfinland.fi -page
relevant_communication: EUSEW energy saving event with sister organisations from Sweden, Denmark, Scotland, Iceland. Best practices in energy saving  -theme. Had same kind event in 2017 EUSEW.
goals__remit:
The Association's EU policy objectives 
-EU decisions take onto account local and regional perspectives and the special features of the municipality-based Nordic welfare model 
-A prior assessment is made of the administrative and economic impacts of EU legislation on local and regional authorities 
-EU legislation is reduced and simplified 
-Competitiveness objectives are set in a way that promotes social justice and wllbeing 
Local authorities are given more opportunities to influence the preparation of EU issues at the national level.
